post_text:
From Mrs. Bridges (School Counselor):
To aid in the class scheduling process, I have created a quick questionnaire for Grades 7-10. (Links will be provided on separate posts and will be emailed out to their school email- only fill out the form once)

Students in Grades 11th and 12th will be contacted individually via their school email to set up an appointment for a Zoom or Face to Face meeting. (Zoom is preferred but not required)

If you are unable to do either option, you can enroll in classes the first day of school. Also, students who are new to the district can request a Face to Face meeting to discuss class options. Please contact me at school at 816-297-2656 ext 105.
text:
From Mrs. Bridges (School Counselor):
To aid in the class scheduling process, I have created a quick questionnaire for Grades 7-10. (Links will be provided on separate posts and will be emailed out to their school email- only fill out the form once)

Students in Grades 11th and 12th will be contacted individually via their school email to set up an appointment for a Zoom or Face to Face meeting. (Zoom is preferred but not required)

If you are unable to do either option, you can enroll in classes the first day of school. Also, students who are new to the district can request a Face to Face meeting to discuss class options. Please contact me at school at 816-297-2656 ext 105.

post_text:
The Ballard R-2 School District has a part-time position available in the area of Food Service. Duties will include: Preparing and serving meals to students.
Cleaning of the food service area.
Must be able to lift up to 50lbs.
This is a part-time position of approximately 20-28 hours per week, normally Tuesday through Friday. If interested, please obtain an application and return it to the Ballard R-2 School District.
We would like to fill the position by August 25, 2020.
Must be able to pass a background check.
If you should have questions, please call John Siebeneck, Superintendent, 816-297-2656 ext. 101.

post_text:
Ballard R-2 Students and Parents:

The Ballard R-2 School District has been working to develop the initial phases of a reopening plan for the start of the 2020-2021 school year.

The district is working closely with the Bates County Health Department and the Missouri Department of Elementary and Secondary Education to be able to open the school doors for in person learning for our students.

Once the plans are finalized, we will share them with our patrons. Please know that these plans could change as information from the state and local health officials update daily.

Thank You
John Siebeneck
Ballard R-2 Superintendent

post_text: We would like to recognize our Seniors. We know it has been a rough year but all of the teachers and staff are very proud of each and every one of you!!
text: We would like to recognize our Seniors. We know it has been a rough year but all of the teachers and staff are very proud of each and every one of you!!

post_text:
Attention all parents and students of the Ballard R2 School District:
Teachers & staff have gathered all your student's belongings. Your student(s) belongings will be available to pick up next week, May 5 - 7, in this order:
We will go by the first letter in your last name:

A - F Tuesday, May 5, 9 am - 4 pm
G - P Wednesday, May 6, 9 am - 4 pm
Q - Z Thursday, May 7, 9 am - 4 pm

If you have two last names in your household you will be able to pick up for all students in your family at one time.
No one will be allowed to go through the school building, please come to the front office and we will get your student's bag to you.
If students have anything that belongs to the school, please return those items. Such as uniforms, text books, library books, ect. Also, paying any unpaid lunch bills will be appreciated at this time.

If you have any questions about picking up your child(ren)'s things, please contract the school @ 816-297-2656.

From all the staff we thank you for your cooperation.

We hope all is well and we miss all of our students!!!!

Have a great summer!

Have a great summer!

March 23, 2020

Dear Ballard Families,

MEALS ANNOUNCEMENT
As we continue to work through the COVID-19 situation, we are wanting to see if there is a need to provide an afternoon meal for our students. If this is something that you would be interested in, please contact the main office at 816-297-2656 between the hours of 10am and 1pm by Wednesday the 26th and let us know if this service is provided how many meals would be needed.

Respectfully,

Dustin Bridges
Ballard R-II Principal

post_text:
The Ballard R-2 School District is pleased to be working in conjunction with the Adrian Optimist Club to honor a Student of the Month for the 2019-2020 school year.
Student of the Month is selected by the staff of the Ballard R-II School District using the following criteria: attendance, attitude towards others and school, behavior, leadership, and improvement in or maintenance of good grades.
The Student of the Month for February is Freshman Lexie Ward, daughter of Beverly and Mike Ward. Mr. Dunkin states, “Lexie is a pleasure to have in class, she always asks relevant questions and is a good role model for other students.” Librarian, Ms. Burgin states, “Lexie is much deserving of student of the month, she always has a respectful attitude toward fellow students and staff. She almost always has a smile.”
For Lexie’s hard work in school, she is receiving a certificate of recognition from the Adrian Optimist Club and $20.00 in Adrian Chamber of Commerce “Chamber Bucks.” Pictured: Principal Dustin Bridges, Lexie Ward, and an Optimist Member
text:

post_text:
Four Students from Ballard received Basketball awards. For the boys basketball season, Senior Jackson Rotert received First Team All-District and First Team All-Conference. Junior Garrett Oerke received Second Team All-District and Second Team All-Conference. Freshman Kale Oerke received Honorable Mention All-Conference.

For the girls basketball season, Sophomore Sudie Callahan received Honorable Mention All-Conference.

Congratulations to the four students for receiving these awards.
text:

Junior Garrett Oerke received Second Team All-District and Second Team All-Conference. Freshman Kale Oerke received Honorable Mention All-Conference.

For the girls basketball season, Sophomore Sudie Callahan received Honorable Mention All-Conference.

Congratulations to the four students for receiving these awards.

post_text: Three members of the Ballard volleyball team received the Academic All-State award for the 2018 volleyball season. They are senior Kelsey Pray, sophomore Sudie Callahan, and sophomore Serenity Morris. The requirements for Academic All-State are a 3.6 cumulative GPA from athletes entire career (include 2018 1st Semester) and played in 75% of varsity matches. Congratulations ladies!
text: Three members of the Ballard volleyball team received the Academic All-State award for the 2018 volleyball season. They are senior Kelsey Pray, sophomore Sudie Callahan, and sophomore Serenity Morris. The requirements for Academic All-State are a 3.6 cumulative GPA from athletes entire career (include 2018 1st Semester) and played in 75% of varsity matches. Congratulations ladies!

post_text:
Beginning January 28, Verizon customers will no longer be able to receive REMIND messages from schools. They will begin treating these messages like SPAM. If you are a Verizon customer, please make your voice heard. Help keep Remind free for educators, parents, and students.

Call Verizon 1-800-922-0204
#ReverseTheFee

Follow this link to learn more.
https://www.remind.com/resources/verizon-fee

shared_text:
Miranda Bridges
December 12, 2018 at 4:55 PM ·

We still have 8 stars on the Angel Tree!!! Not bad considering we started with 84!!!! This tree is going to help 7 families and 21 children this holiday season! Way to go Ballard!!! You never disappoint!!
If you would like a star off of the tree but can’t make it to school, let me know and we will figure out how to get one to you. I would like all presents delivered by Monday so I have time to take stock of what we have and what is missing before delivering on December 20th! Thank you again!!!

post_text: The Book Fair starts Monday, Dec. 10th and goes through until Friday, Dec. 14th. It'll open during school hours for students that want to make purchases. Also, it will be open during the Christmas program Thursday evening. Grandparents if you would like to purchase anything, the book fair will also be open during the Grandparent's Lunch on Friday. Books make great Christmas gifts!!
